security_audit.summary: This skill contains only template files for Claude Code extensions. The only executable is a bash script template (hook-script.sh) with no harmful commands and proper error handling. All files are pure templates with placeholders. No network calls, no credential access, no obfuscated code.

content.user_title: Create Claude Code extensions from templates
content.value_statement: Building Claude Code extensions requires proper structure and configuration. These starter templates provide proven patterns for agents, skills, commands, and hook scripts so you can scaffold extensions correctly the first time.
actual_capabilities: Agent template with focus areas, quality checklist, and references
Skill template with YAML frontmatter and command examples
Command template with execution flow and options documentation
Hook script template with input validation and exit codes
Naming conventions for all extension types
Quick start examples for each template type
limitations: Templates require manual editing to customize
No automated template generation via conversation
Hook script requires bash and jq dependencies

prompt_templates.title: New Agent
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to create a new [technology] expert agent. Copy the agent template from claude-code-templates to ~/.claude/agents/[technology]-expert.md and help me customize the focus areas and quality checklist.

prompt_templates.title: New Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called [skill-name] in ~/.claude/skills/. Copy the skill template from claude-code-templates and help me fill in the commands and examples.

prompt_templates.title: New Command
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a /[command-name] slash command. Copy the command template from claude-code-templates and help me define the execution flow and options.

prompt_templates.title: Hook Script
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a hook script that validates file paths before write operations. Copy the hook template from claude-code-templates and customize it to block path traversal attacks.

output_examples.input: I need to create a Python expert agent for my team
output: Customize focus areas: decorators, async, typing
Add quality checklist items for PEP 8 compliance

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines and use references/ for detailed documentation
Use descriptive trigger keywords in description field for better agent discovery
Test templates in a non-production project before deploying team-wide
anti_patterns: Using generic descriptions without trigger keywords for agent discovery
Skipping quality checklists or focus areas in agent templates
Mixing dynamic content with static patterns that could benefit from caching

faq.question: Which Claude versions support these templates?
faq.answer: Claude Code CLI 0.6+ supports agents, skills, commands, and hooks via the ~/.claude/ directory structure.

faq.question: What are the file size limits for templates?
faq.answer: SKILL.md should stay under 500 lines. Large reference files can exceed 1024 tokens to benefit from prompt caching.

faq.question: How do I integrate templates with my existing workflow?
faq.answer: Copy templates to your ~/.claude/ directories, edit placeholders, and reference them in your conversation or settings.json.

faq.question: Is my data safe with hook scripts?
faq.answer: Hook scripts run locally with your permissions. Review scripts before execution and only use trusted templates from known sources.

faq.question: Why is my template not being recognized?
faq.answer: Ensure the name field matches the filename exactly, use lowercase with hyphens, and place files in the correct ~/.claude subdirectories.

faq.question: How is this different from built-in Claude Code features?
faq.answer: These templates provide custom extension patterns beyond default capabilities, allowing personalized agents, skills, and automation hooks.
